fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: ETP Food for Life, H2020 research programming and calls, ActInPak COST Action, EFSA consultations, EIT Food, FOODforce, World Food Day,
organisation_name: The European Association for Food Safety (SAFE)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Global harmonization initiative 
ETP Food For Life 
FOODForce
goals__remit: The SAFE consortium (SAFE) works to keep food safety high on the agenda of funding bodies, regulators, government, industry, researchers and the general public, partly by drawing the attention of research programmers and others to the key current issues relevant to food safety. The consortium offers a unique contribution to food safety research discussions through workshops and seminars where representatives from research, universities, industry, consumer groups, regulators and assessors share expertise and further develop an integrated vision of where food safety is and where it needs to be. SAFE builds partnerships among organisations with different missions to further a single agenda: Food safety for today and tomorrow.
relevant_communication: SAFE encourages scientific discussion by publishing White Papers such as ‘Keeping Food Safety on the Agenda’, in 2013, and yearly position papers, most recently ‘Natural and Microbial Contaminants: Riskier Than We Think? in April 2018. SAFE released a video summary of the Natural Contaminants workshop in January 2018, see it on the SAFE website.
